summary_reasoning: Key valuation drivers are explicitly listed (Appendix and Fair Value sections) and proximate to the forecasts they inform. Specificity is solid: the report states magnitudes and horizons for revenue CAGR (~20–25% FY2025–29), operating margin expansion (~21% → ~28% by FY2029), WACC (~10%), terminal growth (3%), tax rate (22–23%), capex (~3–4% of revenue), and even embeds ARR ($10–15B by 2029) and FCF margin (~30%+). Justification is partial: revenue growth is anchored to management guidance and industry growth (IDC), gross margins tie to historical subscription margins, but WACC and terminal growth are asserted without evidentiary support. Internal consistency has a notable issue: the stated “P/S ~95×” conflicts with the report’s own market cap and revenue figures. Most other figures reconcile to the Financials Snapshot. Critically, there is no quantified sensitivity or scenario analysis for material drivers (revenue growth, margins, WACC, terminal growth), triggering a hard cap at Fair. Share count/dilution assumptions are absent. Overall, assumptions are explicit and specific but weakly justified in places and lack stress-testing, with one clear numeric contradiction.

assumptions_extracted.quote: Key profit drivers include steep subscription gross margins (~80%)
Capex is modest (~3–4% of revenue) as a SaaS provider.
our model embeds $10–15B in ARR by 2029 and ~30%+ free cash flow margins by then

contradictions.description: Text states “P/S ~95×” which conflicts with the report’s market cap ($116.6B) and FY2026 revenue ($4.77B), implying ~24× P/S, not 95×.
